attributes.action: To introduce a law protecting private property from free roaming domestic cats
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We seek a cat kind solution.
We don't hate cats.

The RSPB estimates the free roaming cats kill five million birds and 220 million other animals every year in
Britain. 

Research shows cats will roam up to a kilometre from their home says Rob Cameron of English Nature. They
can do enormous damage to wildlife.

There are about 10 million pet cats. Double the number of 20 years ago

Cat ownership should be restricted with planning laws This has already happened on some new estates near nature conservation areas

Cat owners be required to keep their animals within their own boundaries using chicken wire fences etc.

Cats to be fitted with approved quick release bells.

Gardens are becoming increasingly important as providers of food
and shelter to many  birds and mammals, because of a decrease in natural habitats and food sources. 
 
But gardens are also becoming increasingly important as providers of food to humans, because of increases in prices.

This  is made at best unpleasant and at worst hazardous to health by the deposits left by cats.
Join CatControl on Yahoo groups for help and information
